page.title: 05BOUNDARY FARM. DAIRY HERD
page.content: On the farm there are 32 Fresian cows which are milked twice a day. A good cow will produce about five gallons of milk a day and this is stored in a refridgerated tank until collected by a bulk tanker. During the summer the herd grazes on permanent pasture, while in winter they are fed on barley, hay and animal cake. MARKETS. Mr Fairclough uses various markets for his produce. The milk is sold to the local dairy for bottling, barley is sold to local corn merchants for animal feed or for the brewery trade, while vegetables are sold on the wholesale market in Ormskirk.
